main event: A bright, stationary object was observed in the sky west of Jonesboro, Georgia on November 7, 1957.
interesting points: The object was detected on radar and observed visually for about 32 minutes.
The object was described as large and bright, lasting about 5 minutes before disappearing.
The observer, Mrs. -------, a 33-year-old machine operator, was afraid of the object and called her mother to see it.
The object was located in the northern part of the sky at an elevation of 45 degrees, close to the stars.
The object was visible for about 3 hours before disappearing.
sighted object: a large, bright object on radar and in the sky
